defs: = ಅಡ್ಡಣ.
= ಅಡ್ಡಣಿಗೆ.
the thread stretched out crosswise in a loom; weft.
a low-level stool, with three legs, for placing the dining plate on.
to hold or use a metal plate as a shield against sword or spear attack.
= ಅಡ್ಡಣ.
an artificial barricade across the flow of a river to control or hold back the water; a dam.
the plant Ouratia angustifolia of Ochnaceae family.
the plant Gomphia angustifolia of Ochnaceae family.
a structure with a huge valve for regulating flow of water from a reservoir or a water tank; a flood-gate.
the state of being, lying or moving across.
(dial.) the state of being crooked; crookedness.
a narrow passage.
a difficult situation.
a head with unnatural shape; an ugly-shaped head.
a plant or animal which is the offspring of a union between different races, species, genera or varieties; a mongrel; a hybrid.
to strike from one side.
to obstruct; to impede.
a small field that touches or crosses the boundary of a larger one.
want of order or discipline; haphazardness.
haphazardly; disorderly; clumsily.
(dial.) a supplementary dish or a light eatable.
to turn oneself from the regular path.
to think cunningly.
to turn another, an object across.
a turning point where different roads intersect.
(dial.) a small road across a main one.
to obstruct one's movement or plan of action; to thwart; to interfere.
that which causes obstruction; an obstacle; an interference.
to go away from one's way.
a beam from side to side (i.e. across the length of the building).
= ಅಡ್ಡತೊಲೆ.
an arm stretched across (as to avoid another's progress).
the beam of a weighing balance on both sides of which are hung two pans or weighing plates.
= ಅಡ್ಡದಂಡಿ.
the transverse roller over which the warp of a loom passes.
the beam on which the palanquin is transversely fixed; such a palanquin itself.
a pole fixed to two opposite walls, below the ceiling ( a set of which is used as a shelf or a loft).
the inner diameter of a granary.
a head with unnatural shape; an ugly-shaped head.
a small road running across a main road; a cross-road; a by-path.
an improper way or manner;

ಅಡ್ಡದಾರಿಗೆ ಇಳಿ aḍḍadārige iḷi = ಅಡ್ಡದಾರಿಹಿಡಿ; ಅಡ್ಡದಾರಿಹಿಡಿ aḍḍadārihiḍi to take up an unsocial, immoral or illegal way; ಅಡ್ಡದಾರಿಹಿಡಿಸು aḍḍadārihiḍisu to spoil another by engaging in unsocial, immoral activity; ಅಡ್ಡದಾರಿಗೆ ಹಚ್ಚು aḍḍdārigehaccu = ಅಡ್ಡದಾರಿಹಿಡಿಸು.
a horizontal beam supporting and spreading weight; a sleeper; a cross beam.
an obsolete coin of a very meagre value.
(fig.) a coin of very small value, hence, a worthless thing.
money earned in violation of official, social or moral regulations; bribe.
a knot of the hair (of a woman) positioned slightly sidewise.
a hefty man.
= ಅಡ್ಡತೊಲೆ.
= ಅಡ್ಡತೋಳು.
to appear across or from the side.
a contemptuous laughter; a disrespectful or deriding smile.
a brutal, uncivilised man; a ruffian.
an useless man.
a crooked man; a cheat.
a person or an animal of mixed breed.
an offspring of unknown parents; a mongrel.
a name, other than the real one, by a person is addressed.
a family name that forms a part of one's name.
a sectarian mark of sandal paste across the forehead.
one who habitually lies.
the habit of interfering in an unconcerned discussion.
a stone slab placed across on the top of a well;
ಅಡ್ಡನಾಲಗೆಹಾಕು aḍḍa nālage hāku (dial.) to intervene in a conversation to which one was not at first a party; 2. to die (as a cattle does at the time of death, throwing its tongue out and across).
a frame for hanging clothes.
a small sliding box in a table; a drawer.
dimension of both length and breadth.
woven structure of warp and weft; a piece of cloth (as woven on a loom).
an opposing statement or argument.
to make a statement against something; to oppose verbally.
across.
in opposition; opposingly.
in a dining hall, a row of diners across the other row.
in a common dining hall, a row meant exclusively for people of lower social or religious status, and, such people.
a class or group of persons who are different from the traditional or conventional mass.

a long and thin metal or wooden piece fixed from side to side.
the upper or lower part of a door or window frame.
a belt across the chest and above the upper shirt to hold bullets.

a palanquin carried transversely on the road; a cross-palanquin.

a tax levied on the goods conveyed, sold on a cross road.

to come across; to come on the way.

intervention in a conversation to which one is not at first a party.
an inauspicious saying or statement;

a cross band of a sandal that passes over the foot from side to side; a cross bar.

to beat, strike heavily, as to make fall across.
to cause (another) to prostrate.

to stretch one's body to the full length on the ground either in respect or in supplication; to prostrate.
to object; to obstruct.

a wooden beam fixed across the slopes of two opposite walls.
a sectarian mark made of sandal paste, a dye etc. across the forehead.
a wooden bar to prevent a door from being opened.

untimely rain; off-season rain.
a word, statement not in agreement with the circumstance.
a saying, statement causing a deviation or an obstacle.
a saying boding inauspicious happening.
a short cut path (as opp. to the circuitous main road).
a wrong way, manner.
to be lying, placed across.
to be, become an impediment.
a face turned aside in contempt or despise.

a knot of the hair (of a woman) positioned slightly sidewise.

a thought, scheme, that does not take effect; a casual thought or plan.

to be excited by desire; to be ardent to do or to obtain; to be eager.
a small road across a main road; a cross road.
a way or manner not conforming to social, moral rules.

the quality of any edible thing perceived by tongue as different from the usual.
inclination or preference of mind towards immoral or unsocial act or enjoyment; a bad taste.

(turning or moving) across; aside.
from the opposite side or position.
to lie in oneself across; to lie flat on the ground.
to come in the way; to obstruct the movement, purpose or plan.
to stand in opposition; to oppose; to confront.

to sprout from the remainder root, after reaping.

= ಅಡ್ಡಲಿಡು.
to keep across as to cover an object.
the state being from side to side.
extent from side to side; breadth; width.
that which obstructs free flow, movement; an impediment; an obstacle.

that part of the roof projected from the outer wall of a building; eaves.
a tax levied for meeting the minor expenses such as entertainment (now obsolete).

one of the two equal portions of an army.
a wooden plank fixed across, on the wooden or stone pillars.
to come across; to come on the way.
to object; to impede; to hinder or obstruct.
to flow or run across.
a running across.
a small path, exp. across a main one.

an off-spring of two different species, families, caste or race; mixed breed.
to come or run across; to come in between; to block the way; to spoil the purpose or plan of action.

to come across; to appear on the way or in front.
that part of the sari which, passing from below the arm and over the shoulder on the other side, covers the breast;

to come or run across; to come in between; to block the way; to spoil the purpose or plan of action.
